abstract: Bowman Avenue Dam, modest structure in Rye Brook, NY, has become unlikely subject of international intrigue following cyberattack by Iran's Revolutionary Guards Corps; attack was unsuccessful because dam was offline at time, but has nonetheless alarmed authorities as potential dry run for larger operations.
lead_paragraph: The Bowman Avenue Dam in Rye Brook, N.Y., may pale next to hydroelectric power generators, but its computerized sluice-gate drew the attention of the Iranians, the authorities say.

headline.main: A Dam, Small and Unsung, Is Caught Up in an Iranian Hacking Case
headline.print_headline: A Dam, Small and Unsung, Is Caught Up in an International Hacking Case

snippet: The Bowman Avenue Dam in Rye Brook, N.Y., may pale next to hydroelectric power generators, but its computerized sluice-gate drew the attention of the Iranians, the authorities say.
